info.title: Services
info.description:
CRM objects such as companies, contacts, deals, line items, products, tickets, and quotes are standard objects in HubSpotâ€™s CRM. These core building blocks support custom properties, store critical information, and play a central role in the HubSpot application.

## Supported Object Types

This API provides access to collections of CRM objects, which return a map of property names to values. Each object type has its own set of default properties, which can be found by exploring the [CRM Object Properties API](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/methods/crm-properties/crm-properties-overview).

|Object Type |Properties returned by default |
|--|--|
| `companies` | `name`, `domain` |
| `contacts` | `firstname`, `lastname`, `email` |
| `deals` | `dealname`, `amount`, `closedate`, `pipeline`, `dealstage` |
| `products` | `name`, `description`, `price` |
| `tickets` | `content`, `hs_pipeline`, `hs_pipeline_stage`, `hs_ticket_category`, `hs_ticket_priority`, `subject` |

Find a list of all properties for an object type using the [CRM Object Properties](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/methods/crm-properties/get-properties) API. e.g. `GET https://api.hubapi.com/properties/v2/companies/properties`. Change the properties returned in the response using the `properties` array in the request body.

post.summary: Read a batch of objects by internal ID, or unique property values
post.description: Retrieve records by record ID or include the `idProperty` parameter to retrieve records by a custom unique value property.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

get.description: Read an Object identified by `{objectId}`. `{objectId}` refers to the internal object ID by default, or optionally any unique property value as specified by the `idProperty` query param.  Control what is returned via the `properties` query param.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with their history of previous values. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

parameters.name: idProperty
parameters.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object

delete.description: Move an Object identified by `{objectId}` to the recycling bin.

patch.description: Perform a partial update of an Object identified by `{objectId}`or optionally a unique property value as specified by the `idProperty` query param. `{objectId}` refers to the internal object ID by default, and the `idProperty` query param refers to a property whose values are unique for the object. Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will result in an error. Properties values can be cleared by passing an empty string.

parameters.name: idProperty
parameters.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object

post.summary: Archive a batch of objects by ID
Update a batch of objects by internal ID, or unique property values

get.description: Read a page of objects. Control what is returned via the `properties` query param.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with their history of previous values. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored. Usage of this parameter will reduce the maximum number of objects that can be read by a single request.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

post.description: Create a CRM object with the given properties and return a copy of the object, including the ID. Documentation and examples for creating standard objects is provided.

post.summary: Create or update a batch of objects by unique property values
post.description: Create or update records identified by a unique property value as specified by the `idProperty` query param. `idProperty` query param refers to a property whose values are unique for the object.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

idProperty.description: When using a custom unique value property to retrieve records, the name of the property. Do not include this parameter if retrieving by record ID.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate
message.example: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

idProperty.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object
The name of a property whose values are unique for this object

id.description: The id to be updated. This can be the object id, or the unique property value of the idProperty property
